definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: They just go with the flow.
With things as such , we‘ll have to let things slide.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今，我們也只好順其自然了。

sentences.english: Traceless is a kind of attitude to life, arbitrary, go with the flow.
sentences.chinese: 無痕是一種生活態度，隨心所欲，順其自然。

sentences.english: But its fantastically successful business model seems to have run its course.
sentences.chinese: 但是富士康非常成功的企業模式似乎都是順其自然的。

sentences.english: I'll not worry about it. I'll let nature take its course.
sentences.chinese: 我不再爲此事發愁了，順其自然吧。

sentences.english: Invite a few people to seed your page, and then let organic growth take over.
sentences.chinese: 邀請幾個朋友去你的個人主頁澆花，然後順其自然。

sentences.english: L-LIYA: Too much should not, always go with the flow occurred.
sentences.chinese: 太多太多的不應該，總是那麼順其自然的發生了。

sentences.english: Everything allows nature to take its course, the senior general demeanor, do not not be able to pass with oneself.
sentences.chinese: 凡事順其自然，大將風度，不要跟自己過不去。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it’s just fine to let the bad mood ride.
sentences.chinese: 有時，心情不好就順其自然也很好。

sentences.english: With a little less effort, you could be one of the greats. Ian Plenderleith
sentences.chinese: 少一點努力，順其自然，你也能成爲大師之一。

sentences.english: After that, it all flows naturally.
Pull the troop and let the chips fall as they may.
sentences.chinese: 把部隊撤出來，讓一切順其自然。

sentences.english: If you can go with the flow, you’ll find tranquillity.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能順其自然，你就能找到安寧。

sentences.english: Try for simplicity and if complexity sneaks up on you, so be it.
sentences.chinese: 試着簡單，如果複雜靠近你，就順其自然。

sentences.english: I know that it’s much better — for both of us — to simply let the situation go.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，還是順其自然比較好。

sentences.english: Do your best and let go.
sentences.chinese: 請你竭盡全力，順其自然吧。

definition: to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
to insist on/to demand/to impose
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
take your time/take it easy
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
to resume/to restart/to start afresh
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
it doesn't matter
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
actually/in fact/really
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
